head.note: This manuscript contains: Questions addressed to Timothy of Alexandria , with his replies; A Collection of Ecclesiastical Canons. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 29 items.

relation.desc: Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Questions addressed to Timothy of Alexandria, with his replies
msItem.rubric: ܫܘܐ̈ܠܐ ܕܐܬܩܪܒܘ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܛܝܡܬܐܘܣ ܪܒܐ ܦܛܪܝܪܟܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ
msItem.note: See Add. 14,526, fol. 29 b , and 14,527, fol. 23 b .

msItem.title: A Collection of Ecclesiastical Canons
The τίτλοι of the Canons of the Councils of Nicaea, Ancyra, Neo-Caesarea, Gangra, Antioch, Laodicea, Constantinople, and Chalcedon
The letter of Constantine, summoning the bishops from Ancyra to Nicaea

msItem.title: The Nicene Creed
msItem.rubric: ܣܝܡܐ ܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܒܢܝܩܝܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܕܒܝܬܘܢܝܐ. ܒܗܦܛܝܐ ܕܦܘܠܝܢܘܣ ܘܕܝܘܠܝܢܘܣ ܒܫܢܬ ܬܠܬܡܐܐ ܘܫܒܥܝܢ ܘܬܠܬ ܕܡܢܝܢܐ ܕܐ̈ܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ ܕܡܢ ܐܢܛܝܟܘܣ. ܘܒܫܢܬ ܫܬܡܐܐ ܘܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܫܬ ܕܡܢܝܢܐ ܕܡܩܕܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܡܢ ܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ. ܒܐܝܪܚ ܚܙܝܪܢ ܒܬܫܥܣܪܐ ܒܗ. ܘܒܬܠܬܥܣܪ ܕܡܢܝܢܐ ܕܪ̈ܗܘܡܝܐ. ܕܡܬܩܪܐ ܩܠܢܕܘܢ ܝܘܢ ܝܘܠܝܘܢ

msItem.title: The Creed of Constantinople
msItem.rubric: ܣܝܡܐ ܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܐܐ ܘܚܡܫܝܢ ܐ̈ܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܒܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ

msItem.title: The names of the subscribing bishops

msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡܘ ܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܕܐ̈ܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܘܕܡ̈ܕܝܢܬܗܘܢ̇ ܕܗܘܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܡܐܬܝܢ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ. ܡܛܘܠ ܕܫܡ̈ܗܐ ܕܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ ܡܥܪ̈ܒܝܐ ܠܐ ܐܬܟܬܒܘ. ݊...݊

msItem.title: Canons of the Council of Nicaea
The names of the bishops who were at Ancyra and (Neo-) Caesarea
Canons of the Council of Ancyra
msItem.rubric: . ܕܣܘܢܗܕܘܣ ܕܒܐܢܩܘܪܐ ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ . ܘ ܗܠܝܢ ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܩܕܝܡܝܢ ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܣܝܡܘ ܒܢܝܩܝܐ. ܐܬܟܬܒܘ ܕܝܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܢܝܩܝܐ ܩܕܡ̈ܝܐ̣. ܡܛܠ ܐܘܬܢܛܝܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇ ܕܣܘܢܗܕܣ ܪܒܬܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܢܝܩܝܐ

msItem.title: Canons of the Council of Neo-Caesarea
msItem.rubric: ܕܣܘܢܗܕܣ ܕܒܢܐܩܣܪܝܐ ܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ ܐܪܒܬܥܣܪ . ܘ . ܐܦ ܗܠܝܢ ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܒܬܪ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܐܢܩܘܪܐ ܘܒܩܣܪܝܐ ܐܬܬܣܝܡܘ. ܩܕܝܡܝܢ ܕܝܢ ܐܦ ܗܢܘܢ ܠܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܢܝܩܝܐ.

msItem.title: The letter of the bishops assembled at Gangra to the Armenians
msItem.rubric: ܕܣܘܢܗܕܣ ܕܒܓܢܓܪܐ ܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ ܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ. ܘ . ܗܠܝܢ ܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܣܘܢܗܕܘܣ ܕܒܢܝܩܝܐ ܐܬܬܣܝܡܘ . ܘ . ܘ .. ܠܡܪ̈ܝܢ . ܡܝܩܪ̈ܐ ܒ̈ܢܝ ܬܫܡܫܬܢ ܕܒܐܪܡܢܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Canons of the first Council of Constantinople
msItem.rubric: ܕܣܘܢܗܕܣ ܕܒܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ ܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ ... ܒܫܢܬܐ ܕܬܫܥ ܒܗܘܦܛܝܐ ܕܐܘܟܐܪ ܘܕܣܘܐܓܪܝܣ. ܒܝܪܚܐ ܐܒܝ ܕܫܢܬ ܐܪܒܥܡܐܐ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܬܫܥ ܕܡܢܝܢܐ ܕܐ̈ܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ . ܘ . ܗܠܝܢ ܬܚܡܘ ܐ̈ܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܒܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܡܢ ܗܦܪ̈ܟܝܣ ܡ̈ܫܚܠܦܬܐ ܒܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ ܐܬܟܢܫܘ. ܒܩܪܝܬܐ ܕܪܚܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܬܐܘܕܣܝܣ . . ܘ:ܘ. ܗܠܝܢ ܬܚܘ̈ܡܐ ܐܬܣܝܡܘ ܡܢ ܐ̈ܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܡܐܐ ܘܚܡܫܝܢ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܟܢܫܘ ܒܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ ܒܟܝܪܛܘܢܝܐ ܕܢܩܛܪܝܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ . ܘ .

msItem.title: The names of the subscribing bishops to the first Council of Constantinople
The address of the first Council of Constantinople to the emperor Theodosius

msItem.title: Canons of the Council of Chalcedon and associated items
Canons of the Council of Chalcedon
The list of the subscribing bishops
msItem.rubric: ܐܪܡܝܘ ܐܝܕܐ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܫܟܚܘ ܡܢ ܐ̈ܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ . ܣܓ̈ܝܐܐ ܓܝܪ ܡܢ ܣܘܢܗܕܘܣ [ܩܕܝܫܬܐ]. ܐܘ ܡܛܠ ܣܝܒܘܬܐ ܢܓܝܪܬܐ. ܐܘ ܡܛܠ ܡܚܝܠܘܬܐ ܕܦܓܪܐ ܠܐ ܐܬܡܨܝܘ ܕܥܕܡܐ ܠܪܡܫܐ ܥܡܝܩܐ ܢܓܪܘܢ ܘܢܪܡܘܢ ܐܝܕܐ .. .. .. ܚܠܦ [ܢܨܝܚܐ ܠܐܘܢ] ܕܪܗܘܡܐ . ܘ . ܦܣܩܣܝܢܣ ܕܠܝܠܘܒܐܘܣ ܕܣ݁ܝܩܠܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ
msItem.finalRubric: ܕܗܘܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܕܟܢܝܫܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܒܗ̇ ܒܣܘܢܗܕܣ. ܬܠܬܡܐܐ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܬܫܥܐ. ܘܬܠܬܝܢ ܘܬܠܬܐ. ܕܒܝܕ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ ܐܪ̈ܡܝܘ ܐܝܕܐ . ܘ .

msItem.title: A letter written from Constantinople, regarding the reception of heretics
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܐܬܟܬܒܬ ܡܢ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ ܕܡܘܕܥܐ ܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܡܬܩܒܠܝܢ ܬܡܢ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܝܢ ܡܢ ܗܪܣܝܣ
msItem.incipit: ܡܕܡ ܡܠܠ ܠܝ ܪܚܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܐܢܛܘܢ. ܡܛܠ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܝܢ ܠܐܪܬܘܪܟܣܝܐ (sic) ܡܢ ܠܘܬ ܗܪ̈ܛܝܩܐ. ܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܘ̇ܠܐ ܕܢܬܩܒܠܘܢ̇ ܘܩܪܝܒܐܝܬ ܡ̇ܢ ܡܠܠܬ ܠܗ̣. ܟܘܠܗ ܛܟܣܐ ܘܥܝܕܐ ܕܗܪܟܐ

msItem.title: Letter of Theodosius and Valentinian, addressed to Stephen, bishop of Ephesus, regarding the administration of the churches
msItem.rubric: ܣܐܩܪܐ ܕܬܐܘܕܣܝܣ ܘܕܘܠܢܛܢܝܢܘܣ ܡܛܘܠ ܦܘܪ̈ܢܣܐ ܕܥܕ̈ܬܐ . ܘ . ܐܘܛܩܪ̈ܛܘܪܣ ܩܐܣܪ̈ܣ ܦܠܐ̈ܘܝܘ ܬܐܘܕܘܣܝܣ ܘܘܠܢܛܝܢܝܢܘܣ. ܠܣܛܦܢܐ .. ܢܟܦܐ ܐܦܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܦܣܘܣ

msItem.title: Resolution of the Council of Chalcedon concerning the Confession of Faith
msItem.rubric: ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܬܚܡ ܒܟܠܩܝܕܘܢܐ܆ ܥܠ ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ

msItem.title: Letter of Leo of Rome to Anatolius of Constantinople
msItem.rubric: ܠܠܐܘܢ ܪܫܐ ܕܐܦ̈ܣܩܦܐ ܕܪܗܘܡܐ ܩܫܝܫܬܐ܃ ܠܐܢܛܠ ܪܫܐ ܕܐܦ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ
msItem.note: See Labbe, Sacrosaneta Concilia, ed. Coleti, t. iv., coll. 1785, seqq.

msItem.title: Letter of Leo of Rome to Marcianus

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 1/2 in. by 6, consisting of 151 leaves, some of which are much, stained and torn, especially foll. 3, 56, 66, 71, 72, 89, and 151. The quires, 20 in number, are signed with Syriac arithmetical figures (e.g. foll. 25, %; 33, %; 48, %; etc.). The later signatures, with letters, are all wrong. Leaves are wanting after foll. 40, 56, 65, 71, and 145. There are from 18 to 23 lines in each full page.
The greater part of fol. 3 has been torn away, and large portions of the writing have been effaced on foll. 9 and 10.

item.p: Vellum, about 9 1/2 in. by 6, consisting of 151 leaves, some of which are much, stained and torn, especially foll. 3, 56, 66, 71, 72, 89, and 151. The quires, 20 in number, are signed with Syriac arithmetical figures (e.g. foll. 25, %; 33, %; 48, %; etc.). The later signatures, with letters, are all wrong. Leaves are wanting after foll. 40, 56, 65, 71, and 145. There are from 18 to 23 lines in each full page.
The greater part of fol. 3 has been torn away, and large portions of the writing have been effaced on foll. 9 and 10.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a large, regular Esṭrangělā of the earlier half of the vith cent., perhaps even of the year 812, A.D. 501 (see the colophon).

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.
N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: In the rubric of The list of the subscribing bishops, the word ܩܕܝܫܬܐ was erased and the word ܡܣܠܝܬܐ was substituted marginally by a later hand. Similarly, the two words ܢܨܝܚܐ ܠܐܘܢ are almost obliterated. Marginally, in the same hand as before, is written ܠܐܘܢ ܪܫܝܥܐ ܕܪܗܘܡܐ.
In the rubric of the Letter of Leo of Rome to Anatolius of Constantinople, the words ܠܐܘܢ ܪܫܐ are almost effaced. Marginally, in a later hand, is added ܠܐܘܢ ܪܫܝܥܐ.

On fol. 151 a there is the following colophon, which states that these canons, 193 in number, were carefully translated from Greek into Aramaic, in the city of Mabūg, in the year 812, A.D. 501. This manuscript was not improbably written in the same year.

p.quote: ܐܫܬܠܡܘ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܡܐܐ ܘܬܫـ[ܥܝܢ] ܘܬܠ̈ܬܐ: ܕܐܬܬܣܝـ[ـܡܘ] ܒܣܘܢܗܕܘܣ ܡܫ̈ܚܠܦܬܐ ܬܡܢܐ: ܘܐܬܦܫܩܘ ܡܢ ܝܘܢܝܐ ܠܐܪܡܝܐ ܚܬܝܬܐܝܬ ܘܢܗܝܪܐܝܬ ܒܡܒܘܓ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ: ܒܫܢܬ ܬܡܢܡܐܐ ܘܬܪܬܥܣܪܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ . ܘ:ܘ .

item.p: Another note on page 151a, written in a small, cursive hand of the viith cent., but of which considerable portions have been erased, informs us that the book was presented by the priest Mār -------, abbat of Beth-Raman (?), to a certain convent, in the cemetery of which he was afterwards buried.

p.quote: ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܗܘ[ܐ] . . . ـܢ. ܕܐܬܝܗܒ ܒܗ ܒܘܪܟـ[ـܬܐ̣]. ܡܢ ܪܚ̇ܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ . . . ܇ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܗܘܐ [ܪܝܫܐ] ܕܟܢܘܫܝܐ ܕܕܝܪ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ [ܪ]ܡܢ. ܚܠܦ ܢܝܚܗ ܘܕܘܟܪܢܗ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܟܕ ܡܢ ܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ ܢܦܩ̣. ܐܬܬܣܝܡ ܒܒܝܬ ܩܒܘܪ̈ܐ ܕ[ܝـ]ـܠܗ̇. ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕ . . . [ـܠܝܣ]܇ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܡܝܪܐ ܡܢ ܠܥܠ . . .

item.p: Beneath the note on fol. 151 a there is one of the usual forms of anathema, written, perhaps, by a different hand.

The same person who wrote one or both of the above notes, has utilised the fly-leaves at the beginning of the volume by transcribing on them— Questions addressed to Timothy of Alexandria, with his replies.
Of the erased note at the end of the Questions addressed to Timothy of Alexandria, with his replies, on the mutilated fol. 3 a, nothing can be read with certainty but the following name:
A monk named Abraham has recorded on fol. 9 a that he met with this book in the year 1802, A.D. 1491.

p.quote: ܦܓܥ̣ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܐܝ̇ܢܐ. (sic) ܗ̇ܘ ܚܛܝܐ ܘܝܕܝ݂ܥ ܠܟܠܢܫ̣ ܒܚ̈ܛܗܐ ܘܪ̈ܘܫܥܐ ܘܣ̈ܟܠܘܬܐ ܗ݁ܘ. ܕܘܝܐ ܣܒܝܪܝܢܝܐ. ܒܫܘܡ̣ܠܝ ܬܡܢܐ ܫ̈ܢܝܢ ܕܬܘܬܒܘܼܬܝ ܕܒܐܟܣ̣ܢܝ̣ܐ. ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܫܢܬ ܏ܐܦܒ ܝ̈ܘܢܝܐ ܢܟ̈ܝ̣ܠܐ. ܏ܘܫ

item.p: It was the Abraham who wrote the note on fol. 9 a, in all probability, who perpetrated the erasures on foll. 9 and 10.
The alterations on foll. 86 a, 119 a, 136 b, 138 a, and 144 b seem to be the work of other hands than Abraham.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: An Index to the Lessons proper for the Festivals of the whole year and other occasions; Secular Laws and Enactments of the emperors Constantine, Theodosius and Leo, translated from Latin into Aramaic. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 18 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: An Index to the Lessons proper for the Festivals of the whole year and other occasions
msItem.rubric: ܦܘܪܫ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܦܘܪܫ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܟܬ̈ܒܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ. ܕܒܗ ܗ̣ܘ ܡܫܟܚ ܐܢܫ. ܕܢܕܥ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܡܬܩܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܥ̈ܐܕܐ ܟܠܗܘܢ. ܘܒܕܘܟܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܣܗ̈ܕܐ. ܘܒܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܐܒ̈ܗܝܢ ܐܦܣܩܘ̈ܦܐ. ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܥܢܕܘ ܒܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܫܪܝܪܬܐ. ܕܫܠܝ̈ܚܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ. ܘܐܝܠܝܢ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ ܡܬܩܪܝܢ ܒܥܘܢܕܢܐ ܐܘ ܒܕܘܟܪܢܐ . ܕܥܢܝ̈ܕܐ . ܘ

msItem.title: The Epiphany
Lent
Passion (or Holy) Week
The Sunday of the Resurrection (Easter Sunday)
The Week of Rest
msItem.rubric: ܫܒܬܐ ܕܢܝܚܬܐ
msItem.note: See Dr. Payne Smith’s Catalogue of the Syriac MSS. in the Bodleian Library, col. 115, note b .

msItem.title: The Sunday after the Week of Rest
The Ascension of our Lord
Pentecost, or Whitsun Day
When a man receives the tonsure and becomes a religious

msItem.title: The Apparition of the holy Cross to the emperor Constantine
msItem.rubric: ܒܫܒܥܐ ܒܝܪܚ ܐܝܪ ܒܝܘܡܐ ܕܐܬܚܙܝ ܒܗ ܨܠܝܒܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܫܡܝܐ. ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܣ ܡܠܟܐ ܡܗܝܡܢܐ. ܡܢ ܬܠܬ ܫܥ̈ܝܢ ܒܝܘܡܐ ܥܕܡܐ ܠܫܬ ܫܥ̈ܝܢ. ܒܗ ܗܟܝܠ ܒܗܢܐ ܝܘܡܐ. ܗܘ̣ܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܨܠܝܒܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܘܡܬܩܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܗ ܗܠܝܢ ܩܪ̈ܝܢܐ. ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܘܝܕ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܕܬܫܥܝܢ ܘܫܒܥ ܡܬܐܡܪܐ ܥܘܢܝܬܐ ܏ܚܘܝܘ ܏ܫܡܝܐ ܏ܙܕܝܩܘܬܗ. ܘ . ܩܪܝܢܐ ܩܕܡܝܐ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܗܘܐ ܐܦܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܘܪܫܠܡ ܠܗ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܩܘܣܛܝܛܝܢܣ ܡܠܟܐ ܙܟܝܐ. ܩܪܝܢܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܫܠܝܚܐ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܓ݁ܠ̈ܛܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Secular Laws and Enactments of the emperors Constantine, Theodosius and Leo, translated from Latin into Aramaic
msItem.rubric: ܢܡܘ̈ܣܐ ܥܠܡ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܢܦܝ̣ܩܝܢ ܡܢ ܠܫܢܐ ܪܗܘܡܝܐ ܠܐܪܡܝܐ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 5 7/8, consisting of 77 leaves (Add. 14,528, foll. 152—228), a few of which are stained and torn, especially foll. 161, 164, 223, and 228. The quires, ten in number, are signed with arithmetical figures (e.g. fol. 156, %; fol. 164, %; fol. 174, %; fol. 184, %; fol. 194, etc.);; but the first and second are imperfect, three leaves being wanting at the beginning, three after fol. 155, and two after fol. 159. There are from 23 to 26 lines in each page.
This portion of the manuscript (i.e., Add. 14,528, foll. 152—228) has been edited by Dr. Land in his Anecdota Syriaca, t. i. , with a Latin translation and notes.

item.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 5 7/8, consisting of 77 leaves (Add. 14,528, foll. 152—228), a few of which are stained and torn, especially foll. 161, 164, 223, and 228. The quires, ten in number, are signed with arithmetical figures (e.g. fol. 156, %; fol. 164, %; fol. 174, %; fol. 184, %; fol. 194, etc.);; but the first and second are imperfect, three leaves being wanting at the beginning, three after fol. 155, and two after fol. 159. There are from 23 to 26 lines in each page.
This portion of the manuscript (i.e., Add. 14,528, foll. 152—228) has been edited by Dr. Land in his Anecdota Syriaca, t. i., with a Latin translation and notes.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a good, regular Esṭrangělā of the vith cent.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: On fol. 228 b there is a short note in the handwriting of Moses of Nisibis, stating that he procured this manuscript for the convent of S. Mary Deipara (A.D. 932).

p.quote: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬ[ܒ] ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܦܘܪ̈ܫ ܩܪ̈ܝـ[ܢܐ] ܕܟܬܒ̈ܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܘܢܡܘ̈ܣܐ ܘ[ܦܘ]ܩ̈ܕܢܐ ܥܠܡ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܣܝ̣ܡܝܢ ܠܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܣ ܘܠܬܐܕܣܝܣ [ܘܠܠܐܘܢ]. ܡ̈ܠܟܐ ܡܗ̈ܝܡܢܐ ܘܙܟ̈ܝܐ ܘܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܠܐܠܗܐ: ܕܘܟܪܢܗܘܢ ܠܒܘܪܟܬܐ ܘܨܠܘ̈ܬܗܘܢ ܥܠ ܐܪܥܐ ܘܥܠ ܥܡܘܪ̈ܝܗ̇: ܘܟܬܘܒܐ ܕܟܬ݂ܒ ܢܬܚܢܢ ܒܝܘܡ ܡܐܬܝܬܗ ܐܡܝܢ . ܘ . . ܘ . ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܐܡܝܢ .ܘ:ܘ.

item.p: As it would seem, the name of the emperor Leo in the colophon, ܘܠܠܐܘܢ, was purposely erased by some reader, who confounded the Emperor with the Pope, usually styled ܠܐܘܢ ܪܫܝܥܐ by the Monophysites.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
